news.title: Republican Sen. Thom Tillis vows to block Trump's Fed nominees following Powell probe
news.summary: Trump will face an important obstacle — from within his own party — as he seeks to replace Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell. Trump is expected to announce his choice for Powell's successor soon.

news.title: Capital One drops 10%, other banks hit after Trump calls for credit card rate cap; Affirm gains
news.summary: Trump said he would "no longer let the American Public be 'ripped off' by Credit Card Companies" Trump said he was "ripping off" the American public.

news.title: Trump threatens to sideline Exxon from Venezuela's oil: 'They're playing too cute’
news.summary: Exxon CEO Darren Woods said the Venezuelan market is "uninvestable" in its current state. His comments come shortly after Exxon CEO said the market was "un investable"

news.title: JPMorgan's looming question: What happens when CEO Jamie Dimon leaves?
news.summary: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon marks 20 years as CEO this month. Insiders say he remains as involved as ever managing the sprawling operations.

news.title: Abercrombie & Fitch shares plunge 17% as retailer cuts its holiday guidance
news.summary: The holiday season was solid for some retailers as they posted modest growth. But results failed to blow away expectations. Some retailers reported modest growth, while others posted modest declines.

news.title: Is Walmart now a tech company? Stock surges after AI moves, Nasdaq-100 inclusion.
news.summary: Walmart’s focus on technology to drive sales helps lift its stock into record territory. Walmart’S stock hit a record high on Monday. The stock is up more than 6% this year.

news.title: Why the market is now more sensitive to the latest battle between Jerome Powell and President Trump
news.summary: Precious metal prices surge as conflict intensifies in Middle East. Precious metals are seen as a safe haven in the event of war in the region.

news.title: As big banks kick off earnings season, these are the critical numbers to watch
news.summary: Expectations are building for the largest U.S. banks to set higher performance targets. Regulators are taking a lighter approach to industry supervision.

news.title: Credit-card stocks are sliding, but Trump’s plan for a 10% rate cap isn’t a done deal
news.summary: A 10% cap on interest rates could mean a big hit to earnings at companies like Capital One and Synchrony. But a Jefferies analyst says it’s “highly unlikely” that Trump gets his way.

news.title: ‘We track our finances religiously’: Are we obliged to pay for our daughter’s medical school? We have $2.6 million saved for retirement.
news.summary: “I am retired, and my wife is an employed physician,” he says. “She is 56 and would like to retire as well.”
